page.title: 15Eccleshall Arts and Crafts
page.content: Partly because of its proximity to the {Potteries}and Stoke-on-Trent College of Art, Eccleshall provides homes for a steady proportion of people assoc- iated with art - either in the ceramics industry or in fine art. Most famous of these is{Arnold Machin OBE, {RA,}designer of the Queen's portrait used on definitive stamps from 1967, and on decimal coins from 1968 to 1984. Others find this peaceful area ideal for quiet working on sculpture and painting. In the home the trad- ition of needlework flourishes, part- icularly tapestry, embroidery, knitting, dressmaking and upholstery; also marquetry, woodcarving and toy- -making. Local classes are held in many of these crafts, as well as in flower arranging - seen at its best in weekly adornment of the church, weddings, festivals, and annual show.
